description: personal study ID composed by the first authors’ first surname_year of publication_first title word
age presented in years – see metadata for source of age
species of individuals participating in the study -bonobo/chimpanzee/gorilla/orangutan
Set of task. Each set was composed of four tasks with different levels of difficulty

condition presented to the participant : baseline = condition served as a control. The apparatus for the required task was presented without any prior information about how to get the reward/ end_state = condition where the apparatus was presented in the physical state as if one method to obtain the reward had been applied / full_model = the participant witnessed a conspecific manipulating using one of two target methods and obtaining the reward/ intention = condition where the participant witnessed the same as in the full model except that the model did not get the reward
whether they succeeded in the first attempt

whether focal participants used the same target method that they witnessed in the experimental conditions after taking into account the focal participants natural tendency displayed in the baseline. For a thorough explanation see the publication page 344
